alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Pottawatomie (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 10:59PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Pottawatomie and northwestern Jackson Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1059 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Emmett, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Holton, Emmett, Circleville, Soldier and Havensville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern Kansas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for northeastern Kansas.
